local3OptCase1

public static void local3OptCase1(Nodes p,
                                  Nodes q,
                                  Nodes l,
                                  Nodes p2,
                                  Nodes q2,
                                  Nodes l2)
There are four cases for the local 3-opt. Case1: arcs (i, j+1), (k, i+1), (j, k+1) are switched and direction is not reversed. These switches are permanent and needs to be undone by the local3OptCase1Undo method. No reverse in this case.

Parameters:
p - node i
q - node j
l - node k
p2 - node i+1
q2 - node j+1
l2 - node k+1

local3OptCase1Undo

public static void local3OptCase1Undo(Nodes p,
                                      Nodes q,
                                      Nodes l,
                                      Nodes p2,
                                      Nodes q2,
                                      Nodes l2)
Undo the switches made for Case1: arcs (i, j+1), (k, i+1), (j, k+1)for local 3-opt.

Parameters:
p - node i
q - node j
l - node k
p2 - node i+1
q2 - node j+1
l2 - node k+1

local3OptCase2

public static void local3OptCase2(Nodes p,
                                  Nodes q,
                                  Nodes l,
                                  Nodes p2,
                                  Nodes q2,
                                  Nodes l2)
There are four cases for the local 3-opt. Case 2: arcs (i, k), (j+1, i+1), (j, k+1) are switched and direction reversed from k to j+1. These switches are permanent and needs to be undone by the local3OptCase2Undo method.

Parameters:
p - node i
q - node j
l - node k
p2 - node i+1
q2 - node j+1
l2 - node k+1

local3OptCase2Undo

public static void local3OptCase2Undo(Nodes p,
                                      Nodes q,
                                      Nodes l,
                                      Nodes p2,
                                      Nodes q2,
                                      Nodes l2)
Undo the switches made for Case1: arcs (i, k), (j+1, i+1), (j, k+1) for local 3-opt.

Parameters:
p - node i
q - node j
l - node k
p2 - node i+1
q2 - node j+1
l2 - node k+1

local3OptCase3

public static void local3OptCase3(Nodes p,
                                  Nodes q,
                                  Nodes l,
                                  Nodes p2,
                                  Nodes q2,
                                  Nodes l2)
There are four cases for the local 3-opt. Case 3 arcs (i, j), (i+1, k), (j+1, k+1) are switched and directions reversed from j to i+1 and k to j+1. These switches are permanent and needs to be undone by the local3OptCase3Undo method.

Parameters:
p - node i
q - node j
l - node k
p2 - node i+1
q2 - node j+1
l2 - node k+1

local3OptCase3Undo

public static void local3OptCase3Undo(Nodes p,
                                      Nodes q,
                                      Nodes l,
                                      Nodes p2,
                                      Nodes q2,
                                      Nodes l2)
Undo the switches made for Case 3: arcs (i, j), (i+1, k), (j+1, k+1) for local 3-opt.

Parameters:
p - node i
q - node j
l - node k
p2 - node i+1
q2 - node j+1
l2 - node k+1

local3OptCase4

public static void local3OptCase4(Nodes p,
                                  Nodes q,
                                  Nodes l,
                                  Nodes p2,
                                  Nodes q2,
                                  Nodes l2)
There are four cases for the local 3-opt. Case 4 arcs (i, j+1), (k,j), (i+1, k+1) are switched and direction reversed from j to i+1. These switches are permanent and needs to be undone by the local3OptCase4Undo method.

Parameters:
p - node i
q - node j
l - node k
p2 - node i+1
q2 - node j+1
l2 - node k+1

local3OptCase4Undo

public static void local3OptCase4Undo(Nodes p,
                                      Nodes q,
                                      Nodes l,
                                      Nodes p2,
                                      Nodes q2,
                                      Nodes l2)
Undo the switches made for Case 4: arcs (i, j+1), (k,j), (i+1, k+1) for local 3-opt.

Parameters:
p - node i
q - node j
l - node k
p2 - node i+1
q2 - node j+1
l2 - node k+1

reverseDoubleLinkArcs

public static void reverseDoubleLinkArcs(Nodes p,
                                         Nodes q)
Reverse all the arcs starting from p till the node before q This will result in a route pointing in the direction of p to q-1 changing direction and pointing in the direction of q-1 to p

Parameters:
p - starting location of reverse
q - ending location of reverse

getRoutes

public java.lang.String[] getRoutes()
Returns an array of the routes that are created after this exchange is complete. For use in the Tabu search

Specified by:
getRoutes in class OptimizationUnit
Returns:
String[] route string array
